page.title: 05LOCAL EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There is{little local employment} for men apart from work on the farms or in local trade such as the postal or milk service. There is some{local {work for women.}Some work in local public houses and school canteens. Others are employed by play groups or post offices. There is{seasonal work {on the farms,}such as strawberry picking and apple sorting and grading. There are a number of hairdressers who work from their own homes. Others are employed as cleaners in large houses. The great majority of people work {outside the village.}Some work nearby, where there is some{light industry, and others are employed at the nearby {Dunsfold aerodrome.}Most men however, {travel to Horsham, Crawley, Guildford, {Gatwick and London.
